description: Gets information about one or more deployments. The maximum number of deployments that can be returned is 25.

nested_items.name: deploymentsInfo
nested_items.description: Information about the deployments.

nested_items.name: applicationName
nested_items.description: The application name.

nested_items.name: deploymentGroupName
nested_items.description: The deployment group name.

nested_items.name: deploymentConfigName
nested_items.description: The deployment configuration name.

nested_items.name: deploymentId
nested_items.description: The unique ID of a deployment.

nested_items.name: previousRevision
nested_items.description: Information about the application revision that was deployed to the deployment group before the most recent successful deployment.

nested_items.name: revisionType
nested_items.description: The type of application revision:
S3: An application revision stored in Amazon S3.
GitHub: An application revision stored in GitHub (EC2/On-premises deployments only).
String: A YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted string (Lambda deployments only).
AppSpecContent: An AppSpecContent object that contains the contents of an AppSpec file for an Lambda or Amazon ECS deployment. The content is formatted as JSON or YAML stored as a RawString.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of a revision stored in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the application revision is stored.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: bundleType
nested_items.description: The file type of the application revision. Must be one of the following:
tar: A tar archive file.
tgz: A compressed tar archive file.
zip: A zip archive file.
YAML: A YAML-formatted file.
JSON: A JSON-formatted file.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A specific version of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: eTag
nested_items.description: The ETag of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: gitHubLocation
nested_items.description: Information about the location of application artifacts stored in GitHub.

nested_items.name: repository
nested_items.description: The GitHub account and repository pair that stores a reference to the commit that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: commitId
nested_items.description: The SHA1 commit ID of the GitHub commit that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: content
nested_items.description: The YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted revision string. It includes information about which Lambda function to update and optional Lambda functions that validate deployment lifecycle events.

nested_items.name: sha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash value of the revision content.

nested_items.name: appSpecContent
nested_items.description: The content of an AppSpec file for an Lambda or Amazon ECS deployment. The content is formatted as JSON or YAML and stored as a RawString.

nested_items.name: content
nested_items.description: The YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted revision string.

nested_items.name: sha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash value of the revision content.

nested_items.name: revisionType
nested_items.description: The type of application revision:
S3: An application revision stored in Amazon S3.
GitHub: An application revision stored in GitHub (EC2/On-premises deployments only).
String: A YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted string (Lambda deployments only).
AppSpecContent: An AppSpecContent object that contains the contents of an AppSpec file for an Lambda or Amazon ECS deployment. The content is formatted as JSON or YAML stored as a RawString.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of a revision stored in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the application revision is stored.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: bundleType
nested_items.description: The file type of the application revision. Must be one of the following:
tar: A tar archive file.
tgz: A compressed tar archive file.
zip: A zip archive file.
YAML: A YAML-formatted file.
JSON: A JSON-formatted file.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A specific version of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: eTag
nested_items.description: The ETag of the Amazon S3 object that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: gitHubLocation
nested_items.description: Information about the location of application artifacts stored in GitHub.

nested_items.name: repository
nested_items.description: The GitHub account and repository pair that stores a reference to the commit that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: commitId
nested_items.description: The SHA1 commit ID of the GitHub commit that represents the bundled artifacts for the application revision.

nested_items.name: content
nested_items.description: The YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted revision string. It includes information about which Lambda function to update and optional Lambda functions that validate deployment lifecycle events.

nested_items.name: sha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash value of the revision content.

nested_items.name: appSpecContent
nested_items.description: The content of an AppSpec file for an Lambda or Amazon ECS deployment. The content is formatted as JSON or YAML and stored as a RawString.

nested_items.name: content
nested_items.description: The YAML-formatted or JSON-formatted revision string.

nested_items.name: sha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash value of the revision content.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current state of the deployment as a whole.

nested_items.name: errorInformation
nested_items.description: Information about any error associated with this deployment.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: For more information, see Error Codes for CodeDeploy in the CodeDeploy User Guide.
APPLICATION_MISSING: The application was missing. This error code is most likely raised if the application is deleted after the deployment is created, but before it is started.
DEPLOYMENT_GROUP_MISSING: The deployment group was missing. This error code is most likely raised if the deployment group is deleted after the deployment is created, but before it is started.
HEALTH_CONSTRAINTS: The deployment failed on too many instances to be successfully deployed within the instance health constraints specified.
HEALTH_CONSTRAINTS_INVALID: The revision cannot be successfully deployed within the instance health constraints specified.
IAM_ROLE_MISSING: The service role cannot be accessed.
IAM_ROLE_PERMISSIONS: The service role does not have the correct permissions.
INTERNAL_ERROR: There was an internal error.
NO_EC2_SUBSCRIPTION: The calling account is not subscribed to Amazon EC2.
NO_INSTANCES: No instances were specified, or no instances can be found.
OVER_MAX_INSTANCES: The maximum number of instances was exceeded.
THROTTLED: The operation was throttled because the calling account exceeded the throttling limits of one or more Amazon Web Services services.
TIMEOUT: The deployment has timed out.
REVISION_MISSING: The revision ID was missing. This error code is most likely raised if the revision is deleted after the deployment is created, but before it is started.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: An accompanying error message.

nested_items.name: createTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the deployment was created.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the deployment was deployed to the deployment group.

nested_items.name: completeTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the deployment was complete.

nested_items.name: deploymentOverview
nested_items.description: A summary of the deployment status of the instances in the deployment.

nested_items.name: Pending
nested_items.description: The number of instances in the deployment in a pending state.

nested_items.name: InProgress
nested_items.description: The number of instances in which the deployment is in progress.

nested_items.name: Succeeded
nested_items.description: The number of instances in the deployment to which revisions have been successfully deployed.

nested_items.name: Failed
nested_items.description: The number of instances in the deployment in a failed state.

nested_items.name: Skipped
nested_items.description: The number of instances in the deployment in a skipped state.

nested_items.name: Ready
nested_items.description: The number of instances in a replacement environment ready to receive traffic in a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A comment about the deployment.

nested_items.name: creator
nested_items.description: The means by which the deployment was created:
user: A user created the deployment.
autoscaling: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling created the deployment.
codeDeployRollback: A rollback process created the deployment.
CodeDeployAutoUpdate: An auto-update process created the deployment when it detected outdated Amazon EC2 instances.

nested_items.name: ignoreApplicationStopFailures
nested_items.description: If true, then if an ApplicationStop, BeforeBlockTraffic, or AfterBlockTraffic deployment lifecycle event to an instance fails, then the deployment continues to the next deployment lifecycle event. For example, if ApplicationStop fails, the deployment continues with DownloadBundle. If BeforeBlockTraffic fails, the deployment continues with BlockTraffic. If AfterBlockTraffic fails, the deployment continues with ApplicationStop.

nested_items.name: autoRollbackConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the automatic rollback configuration associated with the deployment.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a defined automatic rollback configuration is currently enabled.

nested_items.name: events
nested_items.description: The event type or types that trigger a rollback.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: updateOutdatedInstancesOnly
nested_items.description: Indicates whether only instances that are not running the latest application revision are to be deployed to.

nested_items.name: rollbackInfo
nested_items.description: Information about a deployment rollback.

nested_items.name: rollbackDeploymentId
nested_items.description: The ID of the deployment rollback.

nested_items.name: rollbackTriggeringDeploymentId
nested_items.description: The deployment ID of the deployment that was underway and triggered a rollback deployment because it failed or was stopped.

nested_items.name: rollbackMessage
nested_items.description: Information that describes the status of a deployment rollback (for example, whether the deployment can't be rolled back, is in progress, failed, or succeeded).

nested_items.name: deploymentStyle
nested_items.description: Information about the type of deployment, either in-place or blue/green, you want to run and whether to route deployment traffic behind a load balancer.

nested_items.name: deploymentType
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to run an in-place deployment or a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: deploymentOption
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to route deployment traffic behind a load balancer.

nested_items.name: targetInstances
nested_items.description: Information about the instances that belong to the replacement environment in a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: tagFilters
nested_items.description: The tag filter key, type, and value used to identify Amazon EC2 instances in a replacement environment for a blue/green deployment. Cannot be used in the same call as ec2TagSet.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag filter key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The tag filter value.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The tag filter type:
KEY_ONLY: Key only.
VALUE_ONLY: Value only.
KEY_AND_VALUE: Key and value.

nested_items.name: autoScalingGroups
nested_items.description: The names of one or more Auto Scaling groups to identify a replacement environment for a blue/green deployment.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ec2TagSet
nested_items.description: Information about the groups of Amazon EC2 instance tags that an instance must be identified by in order for it to be included in the replacement environment for a blue/green deployment. Cannot be used in the same call as tagFilters.

nested_items.name: ec2TagSetList
nested_items.description: A list that contains other lists of Amazon EC2 instance tag groups. For an instance to be included in the deployment group, it must be identified by all of the tag groups in the list.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: (list) ---

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag filter key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The tag filter value.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The tag filter type:
KEY_ONLY: Key only.
VALUE_ONLY: Value only.
KEY_AND_VALUE: Key and value.

nested_items.name: instanceTerminationWaitTimeStarted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the wait period set for the termination of instances in the original environment has started. Status is --false' if the KEEP_ALIVE option is specified. Otherwise, --true' as soon as the termination wait period starts.

nested_items.name: blueGreenDeploymentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about blue/green deployment options for this deployment.

nested_items.name: terminateBlueInstancesOnDeploymentSuccess
nested_items.description: Information about whether to terminate instances in the original fleet during a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: action
nested_items.description: The action to take on instances in the original environment after a successful blue/green deployment.
TERMINATE: Instances are terminated after a specified wait time.
KEEP_ALIVE: Instances are left running after they are deregistered from the load balancer and removed from the deployment group.

nested_items.name: terminationWaitTimeInMinutes
nested_items.description: For an Amazon EC2 deployment, the number of minutes to wait after a successful blue/green deployment before terminating instances from the original environment.

nested_items.name: deploymentReadyOption
nested_items.description: Information about the action to take when newly provisioned instances are ready to receive traffic in a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: actionOnTimeout
nested_items.description: Information about when to reroute traffic from an original environment to a replacement environment in a blue/green deployment.
CONTINUE_DEPLOYMENT: Register new instances with the load balancer immediately after the new application revision is installed on the instances in the replacement environment.

STOP_DEPLOYMENT: Do not register new instances with a load balancer unless traffic rerouting is started using  ContinueDeployment. If traffic rerouting is not started before the end of the specified wait period, the deployment status is changed to Stopped.

nested_items.name: waitTimeInMinutes
nested_items.description: The number of minutes to wait before the status of a blue/green deployment is changed to Stopped if rerouting is not started manually. Applies only to the STOP_DEPLOYMENT option for actionOnTimeout.

nested_items.name: greenFleetProvisioningOption
nested_items.description: Information about how instances are provisioned for a replacement environment in a blue/green deployment.

nested_items.name: action
nested_items.description: The method used to add instances to a replacement environment.
DISCOVER_EXISTING: Use instances that already exist or will be created manually.
COPY_AUTO_SCALING_GROUP: Use settings from a specified Auto Scaling group to define and create instances in a new Auto Scaling group.

nested_items.name: loadBalancerInfo
nested_items.description: Information about the load balancer used in the deployment.

nested_items.name: elbInfoList
nested_items.description: An array that contains information about the load balancers to use for load balancing in a deployment. If you're using Classic Load Balancers, specify those load balancers in this array.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: For blue/green deployments, the name of the Classic Load Balancer that is used to route traffic from original instances to replacement instances in a blue/green deployment. For in-place deployments, the name of the Classic Load Balancer that instances are deregistered from so they are not serving traffic during a deployment, and then re-registered with after the deployment is complete.

nested_items.name: targetGroupInfoList
nested_items.description: An array that contains information about the target groups to use for load balancing in a deployment. If you're using Application Load Balancers and Network Load Balancers, specify their associated target groups in this array.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: For blue/green deployments, the name of the target group that instances in the original environment are deregistered from, and instances in the replacement environment are registered with. For in-place deployments, the name of the target group that instances are deregistered from, so they are not serving traffic during a deployment, and then re-registered with after the deployment is complete.

nested_items.name: targetGroupPairInfoList
nested_items.description: The target group pair information. This is an array of TargeGroupPairInfo objects with a maximum size of one.

nested_items.name: targetGroups
nested_items.description: One pair of target groups. One is associated with the original task set. The second is associated with the task set that serves traffic after the deployment is complete.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: For blue/green deployments, the name of the target group that instances in the original environment are deregistered from, and instances in the replacement environment are registered with. For in-place deployments, the name of the target group that instances are deregistered from, so they are not serving traffic during a deployment, and then re-registered with after the deployment is complete.

nested_items.name: prodTrafficRoute
nested_items.description: The path used by a load balancer to route production traffic when an Amazon ECS deployment is complete.

nested_items.name: listenerArns
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of one listener. The listener identifies the route between a target group and a load balancer. This is an array of strings with a maximum size of one.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: testTrafficRoute
nested_items.description: An optional path used by a load balancer to route test traffic after an Amazon ECS deployment. Validation can occur while test traffic is served during a deployment.

nested_items.name: listenerArns
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of one listener. The listener identifies the route between a target group and a load balancer. This is an array of strings with a maximum size of one.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: additionalDeploymentStatusInfo
nested_items.description: Provides information about the results of a deployment, such as whether instances in the original environment in a blue/green deployment were not terminated.

nested_items.name: fileExistsBehavior
nested_items.description: Information about how CodeDeploy handles files that already exist in a deployment target location but weren't part of the previous successful deployment.
DISALLOW: The deployment fails. This is also the default behavior if no option is specified.
OVERWRITE: The version of the file from the application revision currently being deployed replaces the version already on the instance.
RETAIN: The version of the file already on the instance is kept and used as part of the new deployment.

nested_items.name: deploymentStatusMessages
nested_items.description: Messages that contain information about the status of a deployment.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: computePlatform
nested_items.description: The destination platform type for the deployment ( Lambda, Server, or ECS).

nested_items.name: externalId
nested_items.description: The unique ID for an external resource (for example, a CloudFormation stack ID) that is linked to this deployment.

nested_items.name: relatedDeployments
nested_items.description: Information about deployments related to the specified deployment.

nested_items.name: autoUpdateOutdatedInstancesRootDeploymentId
nested_items.description: The deployment ID of the root deployment that triggered this deployment.

nested_items.name: autoUpdateOutdatedInstancesDeploymentIds
nested_items.description: The deployment IDs of --auto-update outdated instances' deployments triggered by this deployment.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: overrideAlarmConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about alarms associated with a deployment or deployment group.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the alarm configuration is enabled.

nested_items.name: ignorePollAlarmFailure
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a deployment should continue if information about the current state of alarms cannot be retrieved from Amazon CloudWatch. The default value is false.
true: The deployment proceeds even if alarm status information can't be retrieved from Amazon CloudWatch.
false: The deployment stops if alarm status information can't be retrieved from Amazon CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: alarms
nested_items.description: A list of alarms configured for the deployment or deployment group. A maximum of 10 alarms can be added.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the alarm. Maximum length is 255 characters. Each alarm name can be used only once in a list of alarms.
